intro: Centaurium minus var. stenosiphon, commonly known as narrow-siphon centaury, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy surface, while its flowers are arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. This variety is distinguished by its narrower corolla compared to other forms of Centaurium minus.
